Item.SEODescription: The SharePoint Framework provides a modern developer experience for extending SharePoint.
Learn about the tools and libriaries you will need to use to build your SharePoint Framework solutions.

Item.text: Set up your Office 365 developer tenant
Item.SEODescription: Set up an Office 365 developer tenant so that you can test and debug your SharePoint client-side web parts
Set up and configure your development environment to build SharePoint client-side web parts
Develop SharePoint client-side web parts to provide a better customized experience for SharePoint.
Build a hello world SharePoint client-side web part.
Connect your SharePoint client-side web part to SharePoint by using page context.

Item.text: Deploy your web part to a classic SharePoint page
Item.SEODescription: Deploy your SharePoint client-side web part to a classic SharePoint page.
Deploy your SharePoint client-side web part assets to a CDN instead of using a local host.
Add the jQueryUI Accordian to your SharePoint client-side web part project.

Item.text: Use Office UI Fabric React components
Item.SEODescription: Build a SharePoint client-side web part that uses the DocumentCard Office UI Fabric component.
Design your SharePoint client-side web parts to use Office UI Fabric React components, be responsive, and handle publish and edit modes.

Item.text: Add properties to the property pane
Item.SEODescription: Set up properties for your SharePoint client-side web part and manage them through the property pane.
Configure Visual Studio to open your SharePoint client-side web part project so that you can work with the project in Visual Studio.
Add an external JavaScript library to your SharePoint client-side web part such as small libraries, non-AMD modules, and localized resources.
Learn how to use the __REQUESTDIGEST form field in a web part in the SharePoint Framework
Understand definition details for files used for packaging web parts in solutions in the SharePoint Framework
Known issues with web parts in the SharePoint Framework
